metadata.name: THE BIG BANG - GENESIS
metadata.description:
Billions of years ago, everything in the universe was contained in a tiny ball that exploded!

The Big Bang theory says that the universe came into being from a single, unimaginably hot and dense point, also known as a singularity, more than 13 billion years ago. 
The theory says that the space did not exist before this event, rather it initiated the expansion of space itself.  
But what if that theory were nothing more than the impossibility of seeing beyond the observable universe, of not being able to see what is hidden behind the darkness?  
And what if the universe, as we know it, were no longer a small part of a great cosmos? 

The borders of our universe could be nothing more than the beginning of something that is beyond human reason and only the imagination can understand.  
Like the hazelnut in the filling of a chocolate, like an embryo inside an egg.

This is my genesis: The birth of our Universe and this series of art.

This is my vision. Now, close your eyes. How do you imagine it?
